title: noche
author: noche
content: Hi all, I wonder to know is exists any wallet website with bitcoin purple support.Thanks in advance.All the best.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: What do you mean by purple support?If you mean customers care support and you are using a recommended bitcoin wallet, you can ask any question about an issue that you are having, we may render some help which might solve the problem.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: It's a fork, so they use their own network. Currently they only create their wallet for windows and linux, both android and iOS are still under development. Is they really under development? someone said the dev dump the coin, the price was $2K and now it's less than a dollar lol https://www.livecoinwatch.com/price/BitcoinPurple-___BTCPQuote from: pdneves on August 19, 2023, 09:56:53 AMThis is dead, dev is gone. He dumped what he had, made a few bucks and left.Quote from: Charles-Tim on October 08, 2023, 02:29:12 PMWhat do you mean by purple support?I think he meant this https://www.bitcoinpurple.org/

comments.author: noche
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on October 08, 2023, 02:29:12 PMWhat do you mean by purple support?If you mean customers care support and you are using a recommended bitcoin wallet, you can ask any question about an issue that you are having, we may render some help which might solve the problem.I mean to say, for example, Freewallet and others online wallets like binance not have the Bitcoin Purple for deposit, this what's I trying to say. And to ask if are wallets like mentioned before that have the option to deposit BTCP.Thanks.All the best.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: noche on October 08, 2023, 02:37:20 PMI mean to say, for example, Freewallet and others online wallets like binance not have the Bitcoin Purple for deposit, this what's I trying to say. And to ask if are wallets like mentioned before that have the option to deposit BTCP.Thanks.All the best.There aren't any web wallets that support Bitcoin Purple. Besides, web wallets aren't recommended for storing your coins anyway. As for Binance, it's an exchange, not a wallet. Are you actually looking for an exchange that accepts BTCP deposits? As far as I know, there are only two such exchanges:BitxOnexhttps://www.bitxonex.com/market/btcpusdtandXeggeXhttps://xeggex.com/market/BTCP_USDT

comments.author: noche
comments.body: So for now the only wallet is this: https://github.com/BitcoinPurple/BTCP/tree/mainThat's ok.Thanks to all.Best regards.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: noche on October 08, 2023, 02:53:45 PMSo for now the only wallet is this: https://github.com/BitcoinPurple/BTCP/tree/mainBe careful, or you may end up downloading malware into your device thinking that it's a wallet. Why are you still stuck with that project? It's pretty much dead according to some members, so I doubt if the developer or developers would be working on making the coin is accepted by many more wallet service. If you look at their GitHub, all activity was there 2 months ago and that was probably when the so-called coin was launched. After that, nothing at all. If the owners can abandon the coin, then why not you? Quote from: thikachhey on August 08, 2023, 11:07:19 PMHey! are you the guy who made bitcoin white and bitcoin dark?Come on dude, learn something to earn. Do you really believe you can hit a fortune just by creating a coin for a few dollars?Quote from: saha112 on August 19, 2023, 08:03:35 AMUnable to unpack tar.gz archives:alex@ocv-min:~$ tar xvzf bitcoinpurple-source.tar.gzgzip: stdin: not in gzip formattar: Child returned status 1tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now Quote from: pdneves on August 19, 2023, 09:56:53 AMThis is dead, dev is gone. He dumped what he had, made a few bucks and left.
